verses.verse: (All for Christ) Finally, my brethren, (1 Thess. 5:16) rejoice in the Lord. For me to write the same things to you is not tedious, but for you it is safe.
(Ps. 22:16, 20; Gal. 5:15; Rev. 22:15) Beware of dogs, beware of (Ps. 119:115) evil workers, (Rom. 2:28) beware of the mutilation!
For we are (Deut. 30:6; Rom. 2:28, 29; 9:6; (Gal. 6:15)) the circumcision, (John 4:24; Rom. 7:6) who worship God in the Spirit, rejoice in Christ Jesus, and have no confidence in the flesh,
though (2 Cor. 5:16; 11:18) I also might have confidence in the flesh. If anyone else thinks he may have confidence in the flesh, I (2 Cor. 11:22, 23) more so:
circumcised the eighth day, of the stock of Israel, (Rom. 11:1) of the tribe of Benjamin, (2 Cor. 11:22) a Hebrew of the Hebrews; concerning the law, (Acts 23:6) a Pharisee;
concerning zeal, (Acts 8:3; 22:4, 5; 26:9-11) persecuting the church; concerning the righteousness which is in the law, blameless.
But (Matt. 13:44) what things were gain to me, these I have counted loss for Christ.

Yet indeed I also count all things loss (Is. 53:11; Jer. 9:23; John 17:3; 1 Cor. 2:2; (Eph. 4:13)) for the excellence of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord, for whom I have suffered the loss of all things, and count them as rubbish, that I may gain Christ
and be found in Him, not having (Rom. 10:3) my own righteousness, which is from the law, but (Rom. 1:17) that which is through faith in Christ, the righteousness which is from God by faith;
that I may know Him and the (Eph. 1:19, 20) power of His resurrection, and ((Rom. 6:3-5); 2 Cor. 1:5; 1 Pet. 4:13) the fellowship of His sufferings, being conformed to His death,
if, by any means, I may (Acts 26:6-8; (1 Cor. 15:23; Rev. 20:5)) attain to the resurrection from the dead.

(Pressing Toward the Goal) Not that I have already (1 Cor. 9:24; (1 Tim. 6:12, 19)) attained, or am already (Heb. 12:23) perfected; but I press on, that I may lay hold of that for which Christ Jesus has also laid hold of me.
Brethren, I do not count myself to have apprehended; but one thing I do, (Luke 9:62) forgetting those things which are behind and (Heb. 6:1) reaching forward to those things which are ahead,
(2 Tim. 4:7) I press toward the goal for the prize of (Heb. 3:1) the upward call of God in Christ Jesus.
Therefore let us, as many as are (Matt. 5:48; 1 Cor. 2:6) mature, (Gal. 5:10) have this mind; and if in anything you think otherwise, (Hos. 6:3; James 1:5) God will reveal even this to you.
Nevertheless, to the degree that we have already attained, (Gal. 6:16) let us walk (Rom. 12:16; 15:5) by the same rule, let us be of the same mind.
(Our Citizenship in Heaven) Brethren, ((1 Cor. 4:16; 11:1); Phil. 4:9) join in following my example, and note those who so walk, as (Titus 2:7, 8; 1 Pet. 5:3) you have us for a pattern.
For many walk, of whom I have told you often, and now tell you even weeping, that they are (Gal. 1:7) the enemies of the cross of Christ:
(2 Cor. 11:15) whose end is destruction, (1 Tim. 6:5) whose god is their belly, and (Hos. 4:7) whose glory is in their shameâ€” (Rom. 8:5; Col. 3:2) who set their mind on earthly things.
For (Eph. 2:6, 19; Phil. 1:27; (Col. 3:1; Heb. 12:22)) our citizenship is in heaven, (Acts 1:11) from which we also (1 Cor. 1:7) eagerly wait for the Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ,

((1 Cor. 15:43-53)) who will transform our lowly body that it may be (1 John 3:2) conformed to His glorious body, (Eph. 1:19) according to the working by which He is able even to ((1 Cor. 15:28)) subdue all things to Himself.
